it.uniroma1.di.simulejos

Class Robot.RobotInterface.SensorPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma1.di.simulejos.Robot.RobotInterface.SensorPort
  • Enclosing class:
    Robot.RobotInterface

    public final class Robot.RobotInterface.SensorPort
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to a sensor port. This class cannot be instantiated by scripts; instead, a script must use the Robot.RobotInterface.S1, Robot.RobotInterface.S2, Robot.RobotInterface.S3 and Robot.RobotInterface.S4 singleton objects.
    Author:
    Alberto La Rocca

    • Method Detail

      • touchSensor

        public void touchSensor(Vector3 position,
               Matrix3 heading,
               float size)
        Initializes a touch sensor on this port. This method may be invoked only in the script's global scope.
        Parameters:
        position - The sensor's position, relative to the center of the robot's bounding box.
        heading - A 3x3 matrix that orients the sensor correctly relative to the robot.
        size - A floating point parameter indicating the width and height of the pushable square area of the sensor.
